member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.DataVisualization.TimeNavigator.DateTimeAnnotation
member.summary: Represents a DateTime formatting rule for a specific TimeUnit.

member.name: M:ComponentArt.Silverlight.DataVisualization.TimeNavigator.DateTimeAnnotation.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DateTimeAnnotation class.

member.name: P:ComponentArt.Silverlight.DataVisualization.TimeNavigator.DateTimeAnnotation.TimeUnit
member.summary: The time resolution of coordinates.

member.name: P:ComponentArt.Silverlight.DataVisualization.TimeNavigator.DateTimeAnnotation.Format
member.summary: The format string used to create the "Formatted" member of the DateTimeAnnotationItem as used in string.Format(...) expression. The expression has the following parameters {0} Start (DateTime) {1} End (DateTime) {2} Fiscal Year Start (DateTime) (for example, 2005-01-01 00:00:00.0) {3} Fiscal Year End (DateTime) (for example, 2005-12-31 23:59:59.9) {4} Level Ordinal (int) (for example 1,2,3,4 for Quarters) {5} Year Ordinal (int) If the formatting string begins with a '{', it is preceeded with '\' because XAML parser gets excited at strings beginning with braces

member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.DataVisualization.TimeNavigator.ViewportResizeMethod
member.summary: Specifies the resize method used by the viewport scrollbar.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.DataVisualization.TimeNavigator.ViewportResizeMethod.Linear
member.summary: The viewport scale is a linear representation of the scrollbar size.

member.name: F:ComponentArt.Silverlight.DataVisualization.TimeNavigator.ViewportResizeMethod.Exponential
member.summary: The viewport scale is an exponential interpolation of the scrollbar size.

member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.DataVisualization.TimeNavigator.TimeNavigator
member.summary: Control that enables user to select a date-time range by zooming and scrolling through a hierarchical units of time while visualy displaying the selected and total range.
member.remarks:
In order to have a functional TimeNavigator, the following properties must be set:
Set and to define the overall time range available for selection.
Set and to define the currently visible area of the TimeNavigator's range.
Set and to define the currently selected area of the TimeNavigator's range.
To determine the levels visible when a user zooms in or out of the TimeNavigator, set the property.
TimeNavigator has the ability to nest controls within it's content. You can then bind properties of these controls to the TimeNavigator's ViewportStartTime and ViewportEndTime in order to have the content update it's visual based on user interaction with the TimeNavigator. To learn more about this control see the list of TimeNavigator tutorials.
